vn.map4d.map.core.gestures

Class SidewaysShoveGestureDetector

  • java.lang.Object
    • vn.map4d.map.core.gestures.BaseGesture<L>
      • vn.map4d.map.core.gestures.MultiFingerGesture<L>
        • vn.map4d.map.core.gestures.ProgressiveGesture<SidewaysShoveGestureDetector.OnSidewaysShoveGestureListener>
          • vn.map4d.map.core.gestures.SidewaysShoveGestureDetector

  • @UiThread
public class SidewaysShoveGestureDetector
extends ProgressiveGesture<SidewaysShoveGestureDetector.OnSidewaysShoveGestureListener>
    Gesture detector handling sideways shove gesture.

      • isSloppyGesture

        protected boolean isSloppyGesture()
        Description copied from class: MultiFingerGesture
        Check if we have a sloppy gesture. Sloppy gestures can happen if the edge of the user's hand is touching the screen, for example.

        Thanks to Almer Thie (code.almeros.com).

        Overrides:
        isSloppyGesture in class MultiFingerGesture<SidewaysShoveGestureDetector.OnSidewaysShoveGestureListener>
        Returns:
        true if we detect sloppy gesture, false otherwise

      • getPixelDeltaThreshold

        public float getPixelDeltaThreshold()
        Get the delta pixel threshold required to qualify it as a sideways shove gesture.
        Returns:
        delta pixel threshold

      • setPixelDeltaThreshold

        public void setPixelDeltaThreshold(float pixelDeltaThreshold)
        Set the delta pixel threshold required to qualify it as a sideways shove gesture.

        We encourage to set those values from dimens to accommodate for various screen sizes.

        Parameters:
        pixelDeltaThreshold - delta threshold

      • setPixelDeltaThresholdResource

        public void setPixelDeltaThresholdResource(@DimenRes
                                           int pixelDeltaThresholdDimen)
        Set the delta dp threshold required to qualify it as a sideways shove gesture.
        Parameters:
        pixelDeltaThresholdDimen - delta threshold
